DomainVerification.title: Domain Verification Service
DomainVerification.description: Verify and instruct domain configuration, enabling you to proceed pointing to them after DNS TXT record verification.
DomainVerification.how_to_use_intro: This service is designed for a "User" (e.g., a service or backend) that manages domains on behalf of its "Customers" (the end-users who own the domains).
DomainVerification.step1_description: by sending a POST request to /api/domains/push with the domain name and IP address.
DomainVerification.step2_description: for a customer by sending a POST request to /api/domains/verify with the domain name and the customer's ID. The service returns a unique TXT record.
DomainVerification.step3_title: User & Customer: Present the TXT record instructions
DomainVerification.step3_description: to the Customer. The Customer must then manually add this TXT record to their domain's DNS settings.
DomainVerification.step4_title: User: Periodically check if the domain is verified
DomainVerification.step4_description: by sending a GET request to /api/domains/check with the domain name and customer ID.
DomainVerification.step5_description: the User can proceed to change its infrastructure/application/service to use the verified domain for the customer.
DomainVerification.api_docs_description: The API documentation is available on /docs. You can access it by navigating to http://localhost:4000/docs in your web browser.

DomainVerification.testing_description: This project includes comprehensive end-to-end (e2e) tests using Jest and Supertest. Tests run against a separate test database (postgres_test) to avoid affecting your development data.
DomainVerification.test_db_point1: Sets up the test database schema before running
DomainVerification.test_db_point2: Cleans all data before each test
DomainVerification.deployment_description: This project is deployed to a Coolify instance. When code changes are pushed to the repository, Coolify automatically rebuilds the project using the Dockerfile and deploys the updated service.
